alert.note: Alert for Archuleta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 6:38PM MDT until August 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL ARCHULETA COUNTY... At 638 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain that triggered a mudslide along Highway 160 near mile marker 130 west of Chimney Rock. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chimney Rock and Lonetree. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 123 and 138. Colorado 151 between mile markers 28 and 33. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cat Creek, Devil Creek, Piedra River, Archuleta Creek, Stollsteimer Creek and San Juan River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
